headline: Ohio Republican Party endorses GOP incumbent Mike DeWine
sentences: DeWine, 75, has faced criticism from some fellow Republicans over his handling of the coronavirus pandemic, and especially over his early shut-down orders and the year-long state mask mandate, which expired last summer.

The deadline to register to vote in the general election is Oct. 11
For more information on how to register and other important voting deadlines, you can visit the Ohio Secretary of State website by clicking here.
The party also endorsed the other four non-judicial GOP candidates: Secretary of State Frank LaRose; Attorney General Dave Yost; Treasurer Robert Sprague; and Auditor Keith Faber.
Conservatives are fed up with DeWine, the gubernatorial campaign of former U.S. Rep. Jim Renacci tweeted after the endorsement.
COLUMBUS, Ohio — The Ohio Republican Party on Friday endorsed incumbent GOP Gov.
The deadline to register to vote in the primary election is April 5.
The party’s central committee endorsed DeWine and GOP Lt. Gov.
The party’s central committee endorsed DeWine and GOP Lt. Gov.
Mike DeWine for re-election ahead of the May primary.
GENERAL ELECTION – The general election is Nov. 8.
PRIMARY ELECTION – The primary election is May 3.
DeWine tweeted his thanks to the party.
